Business Development Analyst Job at Proten International




        
    

        
        Proten International is a leading international Human Resource and Management Consulting firm which provides a range of Advisory and Transformation solutions. Our focus is to align every organisation’s activities relating to People, Process and Technology closely with its business strategy and vision.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Analyst

Job Location: Lagos Mainland, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Develop and execute a business growth strategy that positions Proten's International as a leading provider of Recruitment services.
	Identify and pursue new business opportunities, partnerships, and markets to expand the recruitment offerings.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with key clients, stakeholders, and industry partners.
	Drive revenue growth by securing new contracts and expanding existing client engagements.
	Monitor industry trends and competitor activities to stay ahead of the market and identify new growth opportunities.
	Collaborate with the Recruitment team to ensure that the services offered align with market needs and client expectations.
	Report on business growth activities, providing insights and recommendations for continuous improvement.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's Degree in a relevant field.
	3 - 5 years of experience in selling HR Solutions
	Proven experience in business development within the HR consulting sector.
	Demonstrated success in selling Recruitment services and growing business units.

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "HR / Admin Officer",
  "description": "Ivee Consulting Limited - Our client, On The Run Restaurant, is recruiting&nbsp;to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR / Admin Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Chevron, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are hiring a reliable and experienced HR/Admin Officer to manage human resources and administrative duties in a fast paced restaurant environment.
	This role is critical in supporting staff recruitment, training, performance management, welfare, and day to day administrative operations to ensure the restaurant runs smoothly and remains compliant with internal policies and regulatory standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Coordinate the recruitment and onboarding of restaurant staff
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date staff records, including contracts, medicals, and documentation
	Track daily attendance, lateness, shift schedules, and leave requests
	Provide HR support during peak hours or emergencies
	Ensure compliance with labor laws, health regulations, and restaurant licensing requirements
	Support disciplinary processes and ensure staff follow restaurant policies and grooming standards
	Monitor staff performance and assist with appraisals and training programs
	Manage office supplies and utilities; ensure operational needs are met across the restaurant
	Prepare and submit regular HR and admin reports to management
	Assist with organizing staff meetings, communication updates, and team engagement activities.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)
Recruitment &amp; Onboarding:


	Fill vacant roles within the required daysof request
	Ensure completion of onboarding processes and medicals before deployment


Attendance &amp; Shift Management:


	Submit daily and monthly attendance reports with no errors

HR / Admin Officer Job at Ivee Consulting Limited




        
    

        
        Ivee Consulting Limited - Our client, On The Run Restaurant, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR / Admin Officer

Job Location: Chevron, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are hiring a reliable and experienced HR/Admin Officer to manage human resources and administrative duties in a fast paced restaurant environment.
	This role is critical in supporting staff recruitment, training, performance management, welfare, and day to day administrative operations to ensure the restaurant runs smoothly and remains compliant with internal policies and regulatory standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Coordinate the recruitment and onboarding of restaurant staff
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date staff records, including contracts, medicals, and documentation
	Track daily attendance, lateness, shift schedules, and leave requests
	Provide HR support during peak hours or emergencies
	Ensure compliance with labor laws, health regulations, and restaurant licensing requirements
	Support disciplinary processes and ensure staff follow restaurant policies and grooming standards
	Monitor staff performance and assist with appraisals and training programs
	Manage office supplies and utilities; ensure operational needs are met across the restaurant
	Prepare and submit regular HR and admin reports to management
	Assist with organizing staff meetings, communication updates, and team engagement activities.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)
Recruitment & Onboarding:


	Fill vacant roles within the required daysof request
	Ensure completion of onboarding processes and medicals before deployment


Attendance & Shift Management:


	Submit daily and monthly attendance reports with no errors
	Ensure clearvisibility into shift rosters and leave schedules


Staff Welfare & Performance:


	Achieve required staff participation in internal training or briefings
	Maintain minimal staff complaints through active support and communication


Administrative Efficiency:


	Avoid stock outs of admin/cleaning supplies across the restaurant
	Ensure all staff records and files are complete and organized


Compliance & Policy Enforcement:


	Ensure full compliance with HR and safety policies during audits
	Ensure up to date documentation for all regulatory requirements


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field
	2–3 years of experience in HR/Admin, preferably in hospitality, QSR, or retail
	Strong understanding of labor law, staff management, and payroll basics
	Excellent communication, organization, and conflict resolution skills
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office (especially Excel)
	Ability to work under pressure in a busy restaurant environment
	HR certification (CIPM or related) is an added advantage.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: consultingivee@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Job Vacancies at Whassan Nigeria
content:
Whassan Nigeria is a fully owned Nigeria Company with over 40 years of experience in industrial catering services.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Warehouse Officer

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements


	We are seeking an experienced warehouse officer with an account background and vast knowledge in Warehousing.
	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with 3 - 5 years of work experience. 


Salary
N180,000 - N215,000 monthly.
     

            
    



Application Closing Date: 30th August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: cateringjobsnigeria@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Warehouse Manager

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We seek exprienced Warehouse manager to join our dynamic team in managing our centralised warehouse.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with 5 - 8 years of work experience.


Salary
N250,000 - N300,000 / month.

Application Closing Date: 30th August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: cateringjobsnigeria@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Industrial Catering Campboss

Job Location: Ex Port Harcourt Offshore, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are seeking an experienced Industrial Catering Company Boss to lead our team in providing high-quality catering services to the oil and gas industry, particularly in offshore environments.
	The successful candidate will have a strong background in industrial catering, preferably with experience working offshore, and will be responsible for overseeing daily operations, managing staff, and ensuring customer satisfaction.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage and supervise catering operations, including food preparation, service, and logistics.
	Ensure high standards of food quality, safety, and hygiene.
	Develop and implement menus, recipes, and catering policies.
	Manage budgets, inventory, and supplies.
	Lead and motivate a team of catering staff.
	Ensure compliance with relevant regulations and industry standards.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with clients and stakeholders.


Requirements


	Relevant certifications or training in Catering, Hospitality, or a related field.
	Proven experience in industrial catering, preferably with offshore experience.
	Strong leadership and management skills.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
	Knowledge of food safety and hygiene regulations.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and benefits package.
	Opportunity to work with a reputable company in the oil and gas industry.
	Collaborative and dynamic work environment.
	Professional development and growth opportunities.


Application Closing Date: 15th August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV / Resume and Cover Letter to: cateringjobsnigeria@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: We look forward to hearing from you!
